alert.note: Alert for Hampton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 8:21PM EDT until July 15 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Colleton and Hampton. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 818 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential downpours clustered from Bells Crossroads south to Walterboro, Islandton, Cummings and Hendersonville. As much as 1 to 2 inches of rain has already fallen. An additional 1 to 3 inches could fall through 945 PM, resulting in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. In addition, rapid rises are possible along Ireland Creek in Walterboro. Those adjacent to the creek should remain alert for these rises. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro, Yemassee, Hendersonville, Early Branch, Islandton, White Hall, Ruffin, McPhersonville, Cummings, Pocotaligo, Salkehatchie, Davidson, Blountville, Blake, Stokes, Bells Crossroads, Rhodes Crossroads, Fechtig, Colleton Medical Center and Barkerville.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
